intro: Sarcodactilis helicteroides, commonly known as the false arrowroot, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, yellowish-white flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, smooth seeds. It is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain environments.
